document_data.name: Flynn Silver
document_data.mainbody: '''Flynn Silver''' was a convicted murderer from the city of [[Baldur's Gate]], who lived some years before the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.History:
Some years before the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Flynn Silver was arrested for the murder of [[William Lister]] and [[Simon Trynt|Simon "Simmie" Trynt]]. The state prosecutors of Baldur's Gate claimed that the perpetrator committed the murder as a part of some ritual honoring one of or all the [[Dead Three]] – [[Bane]], [[Bhaal]], or [[Myrkul]]. The dead bodies were discovered mutilated and shaped into some unholy totem. Despite the evidence, the defendant claimed that the murder was committed simply as a payback for being cut out of a lucrative deal. Flynn claimed he knew nothing of the mutilation, nor did he worship any of the Dead Three gods. The court's verdict was "guilty." Flynn Silver was sentenced to death, commuted to being ''[[Banishment|banished]]'' to not anger any of the deities. The hearing was recorded as ''Case File #846''.

By 1492 DR, copies of ''Case File #846'' were old, and their ink – faded. Copies of the said record could be found sold in [[The Bibliophile]], a bookshop in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of Baldur's Gate. One copy was found in the [[Waukeen's Rest]] inn in the [[Chionthar Valley]], east of the Gate, and another copy – stored within an ancient mausoleum at the Lower City Graveyard.
